conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the charged small ball when a voltage U is applied.
The motion trajectory of the small ball is AB, and when voltage is applied, it changes to BC.
Identify the forces acting on the ball: Gravitational Force (G) acts vertically downward, Electric Force (Fe) acts horizontally.
Determine the electric field (E) between the plates: E = U/d.
Relate the electric force to the electric field: Fe = qE, substituting E gives Fe = q(U/d).
Analyze the motion of the ball: Forces are balanced along BC, angle with vertical is 45 degrees.
Resolve the forces into components: Gravitational force G and electric force Fe resolved along BC and perpendicular.
Set up the equilibrium condition: Horizontal component of gravitational force equals electric force.
Horizontal component of gravitational force is G sin 45 degrees = G(sqrt(2)/2).
Solve for the charge q: q = (G(sqrt(2)/2)d)/U, simplify to q = (Gd sqrt(2))/(2U).
